I agree with Ilja -- I used the method (inner classes) for a while, and 
absolutely hated working with that source code afterwards. Now I try to 
concentrate on testing public and sometimes protected or package-private 
methods.

Regards,

John

Ilja Preuss wrote:

>To me, cluttering up the source code *is* an advantage in this case.
>Testing private parts is a smell - if I need to do it, I want the smell
>to be felt every time I need to work with it, I want it to be ugly.
